title: WebAction
text: November 2012 - May 2014
First member of front-end team. Made several technology choices for the front-end: D3.js, Backbone.js, Require.js, LESS, Grunt
Architected, designed, and programmed a user interface that allows users to build and fully customize real-time visualizations for large quantities of big data
Maximized the usability of the visualization interface
Made design decisions to nudge users to design clear visualizations that illuminate relevant patterns in the data
Optimized front-end codebase to efficiently parse large quantities of data client-side
Initiated and programmed an automated front-end build process using Grunt.js
Designed marketing and branding materials (though not the logo)

title: Hackbright Academy
text: June - August 2012
Hackbright is a 10 week, full-time intensive programming fellowship focusing on Python and web development
Gained experience with Python, Django, Flask, SQL and MongoDB, Javascript, HTML and CSS

Created a number of applications throughout the program, such as a movie rating prediction system implementing Pearson's r, K-nearest neighbor, and Euclidean distance, a to-do list using Flask, and a program that generates text in the style of a particular author using Markov chains

title: Ranganath Lab, UC Davis
text: July 2010 â€“ July 2012
Conducted fMRI, EEG, eye-tracking, and behavioral cognitive neuroscience studies
Analyzed experimental data in Python and Matlab
Published academic author in Neuron
Administered lab server system (a Ubuntu 10 server, an Xserve, and two Drobos), serving ~20 machines plus remote users
Lab Python evangelist

title: Washington University in St. Louis
text: Fall 2006 - Spring 2010
Bachelor of Arts
Majored in Philosophy-Neuroscience-Psychology
Minored in Studio Art
